column.name: id
column.remarks: primary key

column.name: drug_hoi_relationship
column.remarks: foreign key to the drug_HOI_relationship id

column.name: evidence_type
column.remarks: the type of evidence (literature, product label, pharmacovigilance, EHR)

column.name: modality
column.remarks: Whether or not the relationship of evidence is to refute the assertion

column.name: evidence_source_code_id
column.remarks: a code indicating the actual source of evidence (e.g., PubMed, US SPLs, EU SPC, VigiBase, etc)

column.name: statistic_value
column.remarks: For literature-like (e.g., PubMed abstracts, product labeling) sources this holds the count of the number of items of the evidence type present in the evidence base from that source (several rules are used to derive the counts, see documentation on the knowledge-base wiki). From signal detection sources, the result of applying the algorithm indicated in the evidence_type column is shown.

column.name: evidence_linkout
column.remarks: For literature-like (e.g., PubMed abstracts, product labeling), this holds a URL that will resolve to a query against the RDF endpoint for all resources used to generate the evidence_count. For signal detection sources, this holds a link to metadata on the algorithm and how it was applied to arrive at the statistical value.

column.name: statistic_type
column.remarks: For literature-like (e.g., PubMed abstracts, product labeling), and other count based methods this holds COUNT. For signal detection sources, this holds a string indicating the type of the result value (e.g., AERS_EBGM, AERS_EB05)

column.name: drug
column.remarks: OMOP/IMEDS Concept ID for the drug

column.name: rxnorm_drug
column.remarks: RxNorm Preferred Term of the Drug

column.name: hoi
column.remarks: OMOP/IMEDS Concept ID for the Health Outcome of Interest

column.name: snomed_hoi
column.remarks: SNOMED preferred term of the Health Outcome of Interest

column.name: title
column.remarks: a short name for the evidence source. Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/title

column.name: description
column.remarks: Description of the evidence source. Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/description

column.name: contributer
column.remarks: Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/contributor

column.name: creator
column.remarks: Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/creator

column.name: creation_date
column.remarks: Date that the source was created. For example, if the source was created in 2010 but added to the knowledge base in 2014, the creation date would be 2010

column.name: rights
column.remarks: Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/rights

column.name: source
column.remarks: The source from which this data was derived. Same as http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/source

column.name: coverage_start_date
column.remarks: The start date of coverage for the resource. Data can be trusted on or after this date and up to and including the coverage_end_date

column.name: coverage_end_date
column.remarks: The date of coverage for the resource. Data can be trusted on or after the coverage_start_date date and up to and including this date

column.name: id
column.remarks: primary key

column.name: report_order
column.remarks: there are several reports in this summary, this is an identifier for each report

column.name: report_name
column.remarks: there are several reports in this summary, this is a name of the report

column.name: ingredient_id
column.remarks: a drug ingredient CONCEPT_ID

column.name: ingredient
column.remarks: a drug ingredient name

column.name: clinical_drug_id
column.remarks: if a clinical drug exists, the clinical drug CONCEPT_ID

column.name: clinical_drug
column.remarks: if a clinical drug exists, the clinical drug name

column.name: hoi_id
column.remarks: the HOI CONCEPT_ID, this is at the SNOMED level

column.name: hoi
column.remarks: the HOI name, this is at the SNOMED level

column.name: splicer_count
column.remarks: counts of SPLs that mention specific drugs and hois

column.name: eu_spc_count
column.remarks: counts of SPCs that mention specific drugs and hois
